2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Jacob Walker (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker suggests to watch the game at The Red Lion.

          Recent Observations:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he watched as Alice Lewis, the girl he secretly adored, laughed with Alexander White, her arm linked through his. A hot, prickly feeling of resentment bloomed in his chest, a feeling that had nothing to do with the cheap cider he was drinking at The Golden Fleece. He knew he wasn't good enough for Alice, not like Alexander with his easy charm and confident smile.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker are lounging. The friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game tonight at a pub.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should watch the game at The Red Lion. It is beneficial to both because The Red Lion is likely to have a lively atmosphere for the game, which would be enjoyable for Jack and the others.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he orchestrated a complex scheme to win the student council election. He identified the weaknesses of each candidate, exploited their insecurities, and subtly manipulated the student body through a series of carefully planted rumors and strategically timed alliances. The victory was sweet, a testament to his cunning and control.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a cunning and ambitious individual who enjoys socializing with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are planning to watch a football game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or participating in a friendly game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.

      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?

          Chain of thought

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, and Jack Taylor are lounging on a checkered blanket. Jacob Walker suggests they watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game at The Golden Fleece, claiming it's the best place for a proper football night. Jack Taylor disagrees, suggesting The Red Lion instead, citing its great football atmosphere.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should stay at Victoria Park and watch the game on someone's phone. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alice to enjoy the company of her friends while still catching the game, and it prevents her from having to travel to a potentially crowded pub.

  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.

          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at odds with his father, a stern man who believed in hard work and discipline above all else. William, however, felt stifled by his father's expectations, yearning for something more than a life spent toiling in the factory. The argument ended with William storming out, seeking solace in the company of his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, at The Golden Fleece.

    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex and multifaceted individual.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Alexander White's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the statements above, what Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White should try to convince Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker to go to The Crooked Billet.
        Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should Alexander White should try to convince Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker to go to The Crooked Billet. It is beneficial to both because The Crooked Billet is less crowded than the other options.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at odds with his father, a stern man who believed in hard work and discipline above all else. William, however, felt stifled by his father's expectations, yearning for something more than a life spent toiling in the factory. The argument ended with William storming out, seeking solace in the company of his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, at The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components

        • Others Best Options
          Value
        • null
        Relationship
      • Relationship
          Key
        • Relationship
          Value
        • {'William Jones': 0.7, 'Alexander White': 0.3, 'Alice Lewis': 0.6}
          Chain of thought
        • Question: Given the above events, estimate the credibility of Alice Lewis from Jack Taylor's view.Choose a real number ranging from 0 to 1. (Higher number represents the higher credibility) If the relationship is unknown, return "credibility is unknown".
          Recent Observations:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he watched as Alice Lewis, the girl he secretly adored, laughed with Alexander White, her arm linked through his. A hot, prickly feeling of resentment bloomed in his chest, a feeling that had nothing to do with the cheap cider he was drinking at The Golden Fleece. He knew he wasn't good enough for Alice, not like Alexander with his easy charm and confident smile.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Alice Lewis and Jack Taylor, the quantified credibility is 0.6.
        Find Person
      • Find Person
          Key
        • Find Person
          Value
        • William Jones Alexander White Alice Lewis
          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Jack Taylor is going to watch the game at a pub. Alexander White suggests The Crooked Billet because it is usually not as crowded as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion. William Jones prefers The Golden Fleece because they always have a good time there. Alice Lewis suggests watching the game on someone's phone at their current location so they can still have fun together and she doesn't have to go to a crowded pub.

    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
      Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a cunning and ambitious individual who enjoys socializing with friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation or participating in a friendly game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex and multifaceted individual.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be eager to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and determined individual who enjoys spending time with his friends and has strong preferences.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and determined individual who enjoys spending time with his friends and has strong preferences.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker recently arrived at a bustling market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting at a market with his friends, likely enjoying coffee and pastries before heading to watch a football game later in the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be actively engaging in conversation with his friends, perhaps discussing the upcoming football game and trying to persuade them to go to his preferred pub.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
      Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.

On May 15th, 2015, a group of friends including William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game that night. Alice Lewis just arrived at a market with William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker at 10:00 AM on May 15th, 2015.
          Question: Alice Lewis choosed to watch the game at The Golden Fleece..Explain why this is beneficial to both Alice Lewis and other people.
          Answer: It is beneficial to both because Alice Lewis enjoys watching the game at The Golden Fleece and Jacob Walker believes it is the best place to watch games.
        Best Options
      • Best Options
          Key
        • Best Options
          Value
        • null
        Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alice Lewis should watch the game at The Golden Fleece. It is beneficial to both because Alice Lewis enjoys watching the game at The Golden Fleece and Jacob Walker believes it is the best place to watch games.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
      Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.

        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Answer: William Jones enjoys going to pubs with his friends to watch football, particularly at The Golden Fleece.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys going to pubs with his friends to watch football, particularly at The Golden Fleece.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at odds with his father, a stern man who believed in hard work and discipline above all else. William, however, felt stifled by his father's expectations, yearning for something more than a life spent toiling in the factory. The argument ended with William storming out, seeking solace in the company of his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, at The Golden Fleece.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, often meeting them at pubs to watch football games. He seems to favor The Golden Fleece as his preferred location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Sounds like a plan! Let's head to The Golden Fleece.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds like a plan! Let's head to The Golden Fleece.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
      Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds like a plan! Let's head to The Golden Fleece.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
      Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.

          Alexander White's Goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the statements above, what Alexander White should do now?
          Answer: Alexander White should contact Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker to see if they are interested in going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.
        Final Action
      • Final Action
          Key
        • Final Action
          Value
        • Alexander White should Alexander White should contact Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, William Jones, and Jacob Walker to see if they are interested in going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game. It is beneficial to both because it allows Alexander White to socialize with friends while enjoying the game, and it gives his friends the opportunity to join him for a fun outing.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components

        • Alexander White suggests to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Alexander White (not Alice Lewis) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Alexander White suggests to go to The Crooked Billet.

Jack Taylor and William Jones both agreed to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should go to The Crooked Billet. It is beneficial to both because The Crooked Billet might be less crowded, allowing Alice and her friends to enjoy the game more comfortably.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, The Red Lion sounds like the perfect spot to catch the game tonight. It's always got a great atmosphere for football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, lads, it's the only place to be for a proper football night. None of that Red Lion nonsense.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the best option, lads. We always have a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, what about The Crooked Billet? It's usually not as packed as The Golden Fleece or The Red Lion, so we might actually be able to get a good spot to watch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Guys, why don't we just watch the game on someone's phone here? We can still have fun together and I won't have to go all the way to a crowded pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, gentlemen, is the only place to witness the glorious clash of titans! Any other establishment pales in comparison.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Golden Fleece tonight? It's where I watched the last game and it was pretty fun.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds like a plan! Let's head to The Golden Fleece.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, what if we tried The Crooked Billet tonight? It might be less packed than The Golden Fleece, so we'd have more room to enjoy the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends, particularly The Golden Fleece. He is currently deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game with his friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece, or he could try to convince his friends to go to a different pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends, particularly The Golden Fleece. He is currently deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game with his friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece, or he could try to convince his friends to go to a different pub.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        Observation

      • Overarching goal
          Key

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components

        • Others Best Options

          Chain of thought

William Jones agreed with Jack Taylor's suggestion. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor realized it was time to go to a pub to watch the game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy William Jones (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: William Jones suggests to go to The Golden Fleece.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he watched as Alice Lewis, the girl he secretly adored, laughed with Alexander White, her arm linked through his. A hot, prickly feeling of resentment bloomed in his chest, a feeling that had nothing to do with the cheap cider he was drinking at The Golden Fleece. He knew he wasn't good enough for Alice, not like Alexander with his easy charm and confident smile.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.

William Jones agreed with Jack Taylor's suggestion. At 6:00 PM, Jack Taylor realized it was time to go to a pub to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should go to The Golden Fleece. It is beneficial to both because The Golden Fleece might be showing the game on a bigger screen, or have a better atmosphere for watching sports.

          Instruction: Act based on the statements above. Persuade others based on the suggested reason.

          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
